verses.verse: "I loathe <WH6962> my own life; <WH9132> I will give <WH5800> full <WH5800> <WH5921> vent <WH5800> to my complaint; <WH7879> I will speak <WH1696> in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul. <WH5315>
"I will say <WH559> to God, <WH433> 'Do not condemn <WH7561> me; Let me know <WH3045> why <WH5921> <WH4100> Thou dost contend <WH7378> with me.

'Is it right <WH2896> for Thee indeed <WH3588> to oppress, <WH6231> To reject <WH3988> the labor <WH3018> of Thy hands, <WH3709> And to look <WH3313> favorably <WH3313> on the schemes <WH6098> of the wicked <WH7563>?
'Hast Thou eyes <WH5869> of flesh <WH1320>? Or <WH518> dost Thou see <WH7200> as a man <WH582> sees <WH7200>?
'Are Thy days <WH3117> as the days <WH3117> of a mortal, <WH582> Or <WH518> Thy years <WH8141> as man's years, <WH3117>
That Thou shouldst seek <WH1245> for my guilt, <WH5771> And search <WH1875> after my sin <WH9128>?
'According <WH5921> to Thy knowledge <WH1847> I am indeed <WH3588> not guilty; <WH7561> Yet there <WH369> is no <WH369> deliverance <WH5337> from Thy hand. <WH3027>
'Thy hands <WH3027> fashioned <WH9426> and made <WH6213> me altogether, <WH3162> <WH5439> And wouldst Thou destroy <WH1104> me?
'Remember <WH2142> now, <WH4994> that Thou hast made <WH6213> me as clay; <WH2563> And wouldst Thou turn <WH7725> me into dust <WH6083> again <WH7725>?
'Didst Thou not pour <WH5413> me out like milk, <WH2461> And curdle <WH7087> me like cheese; <WH1385>
Clothe <WH3847> me with skin <WH5785> and flesh, <WH1320> And knit <WH9360> me together <WH9360> with bones <WH6106> and sinews <WH1517>?
'Thou hast granted <WH6213> me life <WH9132> and lovingkindness; <WH2617> And Thy care <WH6486> has preserved <WH8104> my spirit. <WH7307>
'Yet these <WH428> things <WH428> Thou hast concealed <WH6845> in Thy heart; <WH3824> I know <WH3045> that this <WH384> is within <WH5973> Thee:
If <WH518> I sin, <WH2398> then Thou wouldst take <WH8104> note <WH8104> of me, And wouldst not acquit <WH5352> me of my guilt. <WH5771>

'If <WH518> I am wicked, <WH7561> woe <WH480> to me! And if I am righteous, <WH6663> I dare not lift <WH5375> up my head. <WH7218> [I am] sated <WH7649> with disgrace <WH7036> and conscious <WH7202> of my misery. <WH6040>
'And should [my head] be lifted <WH1342> up, Thou wouldst hunt <WH6679> me like a lion; <WH7826> And again <WH7725> Thou wouldst show <WH6381> Thy power <WH6381> against me.
'Thou dost renew <WH2318> Thy witnesses <WH5707> against <WH5048> me, And increase <WH7235> Thine anger <WH9213> toward <WH5973> me, Hardship <WH2487> after hardship <WH6635> is with me.
'Why <WH4100> then hast Thou brought <WH3318> me out of the womb <WH7358>? Would that I had died <WH1478> and no <WH3808> eye <WH5869> had seen <WH7200> me!
'I should have been <WH1961> as though <WH9201> I had not been, <WH1961> Carried <WH2986> from womb <WH990> to tomb. <WH6913>'
"Would He not let <WH2308> my few <WH4592> days <WH3117> alone <WH2308>? Withdraw <WH7896> from me that I may have <WH1082> a little <WH4592> cheer <WH1082>
Before <WH2962> I go <WH1980> – and I shall not return <WH7725> – To the land <WH776> of darkness <WH2822> and deep <WH6757> shadow; <WH6757>
The land <WH776> of utter <WH5890> gloom <WH5890> as darkness <WH652> [itself,] Of deep <WH6757> shadow <WH6757> without <WH3808> order, <WH5468> And which shines <WH3313> as the darkness. <WH652>"
